info.title: Q/A Notes &nd; &pkgsrc; on Linux ARM, Android chroot

revision.revremark: Initial Draft - Towards addressing build failures with &tc.llvm; and &tc.gcc;, on the affected host platform

section.title: Selecting a Toolchain
section.para: The &pkgsrc; installation, as described in this document, is developed within a chroot environment on an Android 4 tablet computer, one of a Samsung Galaxy brand. A distribution of Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (Ubuntu xenial) is installed within that chroot environment.

The machine itself is using a Linux kernel version 3.4.39, armv7l machine architecture, Samsung OEM distribution
TBD: Kernel headers, for this build . The operating system available within the chroot environment, as such, provides distributions of &tc.llvm; and &tc.gcc; under some specific, versioned builds.
&tc.llvm; release 6 is the newest &tc.llvm; available, in that operating system distribution. The &tc.gcc; toolchain is also available, at &cmd.gcc; version 6 and &cmd.gxx; version 5.

&tc.llvm; libc++ is available, in the host toolchain system, for &tc.llvm; release 3.7. This has not been used, in the following.
Ed. Note: Perhaps that &tc.llvm; distribution should be used, at least for building an initial &tc.llvm; compiler of some newer version.

section.title: Specifying CGLAGS for individual pkg builds

example.title: Build Failures &nd; &pkg.db6;
example.para: Remarks: This set of &var.cflags; was sufficient for building &pkg.libffi;
